titleStmt.title: J. J. Harrison et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6622

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hon Thos E Bramlett
Govenor of Ky

We would respectfully represent that, James W Daniel was indicted in three several cases ^in the Ohio circuit court^ which are enclosed, was as we believe indicted through malice & we would be pleased if his fines should be remitted, He is a good loyal man poor but honest -- If you will remit his fines you will confer a favor upon us

J, J, Harrison
R F Taylor Capt
Co,, C, M. G. R. Batt
A. L. Morton clk Ohio Cir Ct
A B Baird Post Master Hartford
W H Miller Rep Ohio Co
E. R. Maxwell Notary Public
Ben Duvall S, o, c
Jesse Gillshop, J, P, O, C

Ohio Cir Ct
vs
Jas W. Daniel
3 judgts
2 for $75,
1 " $1,50
Remitted
27 June/65
